main event: A bright falling object was observed by a commercial pilot and a GOC observer in Mattawamkeag, Maine in 1955, falling toward the horizon for a period of 3-4 seconds.
interesting points: The GOC observer described the object as red, yellow, and green.
No axial activity was reported in the area at that time.
The delay in receiving the initial report and the lack of further investigation led to the conclusion that the sighting was likely a meteor.
The report indicates that no photographs were taken of the observed object.
The conclusion notes that the data received seems to follow that of some astronomical phenomena, i.e., a meteor.
